title: Requires director of the budget to compile and make public a report showing cash disbursements made on behalf of each entity during the preceding 6 months
summary: Requires the director of the budget to compile and make public a report for each state agency, covered authority and the judiciary showing cash disbursements made on behalf of each entity during the preceding six months.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1073

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DeFRANCISCO -- read twice and ordered printed, and
         when printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to agency expenditure
         reporting

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  state finance law is amended by adding a new section
    2  53-e to read as follows:
    3    S 53-E. AGENCY EXPENDITURE REPORTING. 1.  ON OR BEFORE  MAY  FIFTEENTH
    4  AND  NOVEMBER  FIFTEENTH  OF EACH YEAR, THE DIRECTOR OF THE BUDGET SHALL
    5  COMPILE AND MAKE PUBLIC AN EXPENDITURE REPORT  FOR  EACH  STATE  AGENCY,
    6  COVERED AUTHORITY AND THE JUDICIARY, AS DEFINED BY SECTION TWO-A OF THIS
    7  CHAPTER,  AND  ANY  501(C)(3) NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION AFFILIATED WITH
    8  THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, SHOWING ALL CASH DISBURSEMENTS MADE BY
    9  OR ON BEHALF OF EACH SUCH ENTITY DURING THE PRECEDING SIX MONTHS  ENDING
   10  MARCH THIRTY-FIRST AND SEPTEMBER THIRTIETH, RESPECTIVELY, WHICH SHALL BE
   11  BASED  UPON  ACTUAL  CASH DISBURSEMENTS AS RECORDED BY THE OFFICE OF THE
   12  STATE COMPTROLLER, BASED UPON STATE VOUCHERS AND PAYROLL FORMS SUBMITTED
   13  BY EACH STATE AGENCY, COVERED AUTHORITY AND THE JUDICIARY, AS DEFINED BY
   14  SECTION TWO-A OF THIS CHAPTER.   SUCH REPORTS  SHALL  BE  ORGANIZED  FOR
   15  STATE  AGENCIES, BY AGENCY, PROGRAM, FUND AND APPROPRIATION; FOR COVERED
   16  AUTHORITIES, BY AUTHORITY AND BY PROGRAM;  AND  FOR  THE  JUDICIARY,  BY
   17  JUDICIAL DEPARTMENT, JUDICIAL DISTRICT AND COURT, INCLUDING THE COURT OF
   18  APPEALS,  EXCEPT THAT THE OFFICE OF COURT ADMINISTRATION SHALL BE ORGAN-
   19  IZED BY PROGRAM AND FUND, AND ALL SHALL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING  LEVEL  OF
   20  DETAIL:
   21    A. FOR CASH DISBURSEMENTS RELATED TO PERSONAL SERVICE EXPENSES:
   22    (I)  SALARY  PAYMENTS  TO  EACH EMPLOYEE CLASSIFIED AS NON-COMPETITIVE
   23  UNDER THE CIVIL SERVICE LAW, EACH EMPLOYEE OF A 501(C)(3) NOT-FOR-PROFIT
   24  CORPORATION AFFILIATED WITH THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW  YORK  AND  EACH
   25  JUDGE  AND  JUSTICE WHO WORKED IN ANY ENTITY COVERED BY THIS SECTION AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07035-01-1

       S. 1073                             2

    1  WHO RECEIVED SALARY PAYMENTS AT ANY TIME  DURING  THE  REPORTING  PERIOD
    2  WILL BE LISTED, ALONG WITH THEIR NAME, SERVICE DATES, JOB TITLE, PAYROLL
    3  TYPE AND TOTAL AMOUNT PAID.  ANY ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION PAID DURING THE
    4  REPORTING  PERIOD  SHALL BE SEPARATELY LISTED FROM SALARY PAYMENTS.  ANY
    5  PAYMENT FOR HOLIDAY OR OVERTIME PAY MADE TO EACH  SUCH  EMPLOYEE  DURING
    6  THE  REPORTING  PERIOD  SHALL  BE  SEPARATELY  LISTED,  ALONG WITH DATES
    7  RELATED TO SUCH HOLIDAY OR OVERTIME PAY; AND
    8    (II) ALL SALARY PAYMENTS RECEIVED DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD  BY  ALL
    9  EMPLOYEES  CLASSIFIED  AS COMPETITIVE UNDER THE CIVIL SERVICE LAW, SHALL
   10  BE LISTED BY CATEGORY OF TITLE. ANY PAYMENT FOR HOLIDAY OR OVERTIME  PAY
   11  MADE  TO  SUCH EMPLOYEES DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD SHALL BE SEPARATELY
   12  LISTED BY CATEGORY OF TITLE.
   13    B. FOR CASH DISBURSEMENTS RELATED TO NONPERSONAL SERVICE EXPENSES:
   14    (I) FOR SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS,  EQUIPMENT  AND  CONTRACTUAL  SERVICES
   15  CASH  DISBURSEMENTS, ALL VOUCHERED PAYMENTS MADE ON BEHALF OF EACH STATE
   16  AGENCY, COVERED AUTHORITY AND THE JUDICIARY, AS DEFINED BY SECTION TWO-A
   17  OF THIS CHAPTER AND ANY 501(C)(3) NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION  AFFILIATED
   18  WITH THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD, SHALL
   19  BE  LISTED SEPARATELY INCLUDING, IF APPLICABLE AND TO THE EXTENT PRACTI-
   20  CABLE, THE CHECK DATE,  VOUCHER  NUMBER,  PAYEE  NAME,  DESCRIPTION  AND
   21  AMOUNT  PAID  ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFIC TYPE OF EXPENSE AS CLASSIFIED BY
   22  THE COMPTROLLER'S OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION FIFTY-TWO OF THIS  ARTICLE;
   23  AND
   24    (II)  FOR  TRAVEL  EXPENDITURES: (1) EACH VOUCHERED PAYMENT FOR TRAVEL
   25  MADE BY EACH EMPLOYEE CLASSIFIED  AS  NON-COMPETITIVE  UNDER  THE  CIVIL
   26  SERVICE LAW AND EACH JUDGE AND JUSTICE, LISTING THE NAME OF SUCH EMPLOY-
   27  EE  ALONG WITH THE DATES AND DESCRIPTION OF TRAVEL, AND THE AMOUNT PAID;
   28  AND (2) A SINGLE AMOUNT OF TOTAL VOUCHERED PAYMENTS FOR TRAVEL  MADE  BY
   29  ALL EMPLOYEES CLASSIFIED AS COMPETITIVE UNDER THE CIVIL SERVICE LAW.
   30    2.  EACH  AGENCY, COVERED AUTHORITY AND THE JUDICIARY SHALL ASSIST THE
   31  DIRECTOR OF THE BUDGET IN OBTAINING THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO PRODUCE
   32  SUCH REPORTS.
   33    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   34  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
